physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Diffuse pink-red plaques and target lesions on the trunk and limbs, sparing the palmoplantar surface and scalp; lesions painless but severely pruritic; no fever, blister, mucosal erosion, or enlarged lymph nodes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The skin eruptions progressed over 3 days before hospitalization. After starting oral prednisolone, the progression of the skin rashes was stopped on the third day of therapy. The original pink-red plaques regressed to multiple dusky target lesions 4-6 days after initiating prednisolone therapy.
